list.name: Default
list.comment: Added a method to BankSystemTest which lists all the AccountHolders initialised at runtime. Updated the data of all account in initialiseData() to add a SavingsAccount, CurrentAccount and Loan. This is so the AccountHolders can list extra information with them

task.summary: Seperated Intellij project from the UML class diagram and Use cases
Added src folder to Intellij project
Changed name of module from src to BankSystem
Added getters and setters for accountName, accountId and isActive
Made checkBalance and deposit method abstract
Added getters and setters for CurrentAccount.java
Added implementation of checkBalance from Account.java
Added implementation of deposit to from Account.java
Added getters and setters for interestRate attribute
Added getters and setters for accountHolderId, forename and surname
Added getters and setters for Loan.java. Did not include setter for startDate as this will be set by the class constructor as the current date at instantiation
Added constructor for Loan. Creates a new Date object as this defaults to the current time at the instantiation of this class
Intellij Analysis: Added description to the top of each class to specify what the class is
Intellij Analysis: Replaced ArrayList<CurrentAccount> and ArrayList<SavingsAccount> with ArrayList<>
Added method addLoan which adds a new Loan to the ArrayList loans

Added toString() method to Loan.java. This is to be used when listing all the loans in the AccountHolder class as per the new requirement which requests loans are to be displayed on command by the user
Added toString() method to Account.java. This is to be called in the extended classes CurrentAccount and SavingsAccount

Added toString() methods to both child classes of Account. Both these classes use a call to super.toString() to call the parents implementation of toString() and then append the extra fields onto the end

Added BankSystemTest.java. This contains the main of the class which will run a test version of the application. In a real environment, all the relevant data will be set up at startup. In this setting we will make a call to initialiseData(), which mocks real data entered into the system.

Added a method to BankSystemTest which lists all the AccountHolders initialised at runtime. Updated the data of all account in initialiseData() to add a SavingsAccount, CurrentAccount and Loan. This is so the AccountHolders can list extra information with them

MESSAGE.value: Added implementation of checkBalance from Account.java
Added implementation of deposit to from Account.java
Added SavingsAccount.java
Added constructor for SavingsAccount.java
Added getters and setters for interestRate attribute
Implemented abstract methods from Account.java
Added currentAccount ArrayList to AccountHolder.java
Added savingsAccounts ArrayList to AccountHolder.java
Added constructor for AccountHolder.java
Added getters and setters for accountHolderId, forename and surname
Added addSavingsAccount to AccountHolder.java
Added Loan.java
Added attributes to Loan.java
Added getters and setters for Loan.java. Did not include setter for startDate as this will be set by the class constructor as the current date at instantiation
Added payAmount method to Loan.java
Added constructor for Loan. Creates a new Date object as this defaults to the current time at the instantiation of this class
Intellij Analysis: Added description to the top of each class to specify what the class is
Intellij Analysis: Replaced ArrayList<CurrentAccount> and ArrayList<SavingsAccount> with ArrayList<>
Added loans ArrayList to AccountHolder.java
Added method addLoan which adds a new Loan to the ArrayList loans

Added toString() method to Loan.java. This is to be used when listing all the loans in the AccountHolder class as per the new requirement which requests loans are to be displayed on command by the user
Added toString() method to Account.java. This is to be called in the extended classes CurrentAccount and SavingsAccount

Added toString() methods to both child classes of Account. Both these classes use a call to super.toString() to call the parents implementation of toString() and then append the extra fields onto the end

Added BankSystemTest.java. This contains the main of the class which will run a test version of the application. In a real environment, all the relevant data will be set up at startup. In this setting we will make a call to initialiseData(), which mocks real data entered into the system.

Added a method to BankSystemTest which lists all the AccountHolders initialised at runtime. Updated the data of all account in initialiseData() to add a SavingsAccount, CurrentAccount and Loan. This is so the AccountHolders can list extra information with them
